definition[0]: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way
example[0]: A piece of glass was embedded in her hand.
definition[1]: if ideas, attitudes, or feelings etc are embedded, you believe or feel them very strongly
example[1]: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
definition[2]: to put something such as a graphic  into a computer program or page on the Internet
explanation[0]: Embed is usually passive when used as a transitive verb
definition[4]: to put something such as an image, sound etc into a page on a Internet website or into a program, using computer codes
example[3]: This document shows you the right tags to use to embed sound onto your website.
